[In Certificates] The Certificates element is used in the following command requests and responses: ResolveRecipients command responses (section 2.2.2.13), ValidateCert command requests (section 2.2.2.20).
[In Certificates] The definition of the Certificates element differs according to the context in which it [Certificates element] is used.
[In Certificates] For more details, see section 2.2.3.23.1 and section 2.2.3.23.2.

[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] The Certificates element is an optional child element of the Recipient element in ResolveRecipients command responses that contains information about the certificates for a recipient.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.23.1] are defined in the ResolveRecipients namespace.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Element Certificates(ResolveRecipients) in ResolveRecipients command response (section 2.2.2.14), the parent element is Recipient (section 2.2.3.136).

[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Element Certificates(ResolveRecipients) in ResolveRecipients command response (section 2.2.2.14), the child elements are Status (section2.2.3.167.11), CertificateCount (section 2.2.3.21) , RecipientCount (section 2.2.3.137) , Certificate (section 2.2.3.19) , MiniCertificate (section 2.2.3.106)
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Element Certificates(ResolveRecipients) in ResolveRecipients command response (section 2.2.2.14), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Element Certificates(ResolveRecipients) in ResolveRecipients command response (section 2.2.2.14), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Although multiple Certificates elements can be included in a response, only one Certificates element is allowed per Recipient parent element.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] element.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] element.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] element.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] element.
[In Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Certificates(ResolveRecipients)] element.

[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] The Certificates element is a required child element of the ValidateCert element in ValidateCert command requests that contains the list of certificates to be validated.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.23.2] are defined in the ValidateCert namespace.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Element Certificates (ValidateCert) in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the parent element is ValidateCert (section 2.2.3.185).
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Element Certificates (ValidateCert) in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the child element is Certificate (section 2.2.3.19.2).
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Element Certificates (ValidateCert) in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Element Certificates (ValidateCert) in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the number allowed is 1…1 (required).
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Certificates(ValidateCert)] element.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Certificates(ValidateCert)] element.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Certificates(ValidateCert)] element.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Certificates(ValidateCert)] element.
[In Certificates(ValidateCert)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Certificates(ValidateCert)] element.
[In Change] The Change element is an optional child element of the Commands element in Sync command requests that modifies properties of an existing object on the client device or the server.

[In Change] The Change element is an optional child element of the Commands element and the Responses element in Sync command responses that contains properties of an existing object on the client device or the server that were modified.
[In Change] The changed object is identified by its ServerId element.
[In Change] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.24] are defined in the AirSync namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Commands (section 2.2.3.32).

[In Change] Element Change in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the child elements are ServerId (section 2.2.3.156.7), ApplicationData (section 2.2.3.11), airsyncbase:InstanceId ([MS-ASAIRS] section 2.2.2.25), email2:Send ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.69).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 0...N (optional).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the parent element is Commands.
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the child elements are ServerId, ApplicationData, Class (section 2.2.3.27.5).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the data type is container.
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the number allowed is 0...N (optional).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the parent element is Responses (section 2.2.3.145).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the child elements are ServerId, Class, Status (section 2.2.3.167.16).
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the data type is container.
[In Change] Element Change in Sync command response, the number allowed is 0...N (optional).
[In Change] The server is not required to send an individual response for every operation that is sent by the client.
[In Change] The client only receives responses for successful additions, successful fetches, successful changes that include an attachment being added, and failed changes and deletions.
[In change] When the client does not receive a response, the client MUST assume that the operation succeeded unless informed otherwise.
[In Change] In a Sync command request or response, one or more Change elements can appear as a child element of the Commands element for a particular collection.

[In Change] Certain in-schema properties remain untouched in the following cases: If there is only an email:Flag ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.34) [, email:Read ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.58), or email:Categories ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.16)] change (that is, if only an email:Flag, email:Categories, or email:Read element is present), all other properties will remain unchanged.

[In Change] Certain in-schema properties remain untouched in the following cases: If there is only an [email:Flag ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.34),] email:Read ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.58) [, or email:Categories ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.16)] change (that is, if only an email:Flag, email:Categories or email:Read element is present), all other properties will remain unchanged.

[In Change] Certain in-schema properties remain untouched in the following three cases: If there is only [an email:Flag ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.34), email:Read ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.58), or] email:Categories ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.16) change (that is, if only an email:Flag, email:Categories or email:Read element is present), all other properties will remain unchanged.

[In Change] [If there is only an email:Flag ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.34), email:Read ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.58), or email:Categories ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.16) change (that is, if only an email:Flag, email:Categories or email:Read element is present),] the client SHOULD NOT send the other elements in the request.
[In Change] If all the other elements are sent, extra bandwidth is used, but no errors occur.

[In Change] [Certain in-schema properties remain untouched in the following three cases:] If a calendar:Exceptions ([MS-ASCAL] section 2.2.2.22) node is not specified, the properties for that calendar:Exceptions node will remain unchanged.
[In Change] If a calendar:Exception ([MS-ASCAL] section 2.2.2.21) node within the calendar:Exceptions node is not present, that particular exception will remain unchanged.

[In Change] [Certain in-schema properties remain untouched in the following three cases:] If the airsyncbase:Body, airsyncbase:Data, or contacts:Picture elements are not present, the corresponding properties will remain unchanged.
[In Change] If an element specifying a calendar property is not present in the client request, the calendar property will remain unchanged on the calendar item.

[In Change] This [If an element specifying a calendar property is not present in the client request, the calendar property will remain unchanged on the calendar item.] case does not apply to protocol versions 2.5, 12.0, 12.1, 14.0, and 14.1.
[In Change] In all other cases, if an in-schema property is not specified in a change request, the property is actively deleted from the item on the server.

[In Change] A client MUST be aware of this [if an in-schema property is not specified in a change request, the property is actively deleted from the item on the server] when it [client] is sending Sync requests.

[In Change] Otherwise [if a client dose not be aware of this [if an in-schema property is not specified in a change request, the property is actively deleted from the item on the server] when it [client] is sending Sync requests], data can be unintentionally removed.

[In Change] When protocol version 16.0 is used and the changed object is a calendar item, the object is identified by both the ServerId element of the master item as well as the airsyncbase:InstanceId element of the specific occurrence.
[In Change] The airsyncbase:InstanceId [and email2:Send] element is supported as child elements of the Change element only when protocol version 16.0 is used.
[In Change] The [airsyncbase:InstanceId and] email2:Send element is supported as child elements of the Change element only when protocol version 16.0 is used.
[In Change] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Change] element.
[In Change] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Change] element.
[In Change] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Change] element.
[In Change] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Change] element.
[In Change] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Change] element.
[In Changes] The Changes element is an optional child element of the FolderSync element in FolderSync command responses that contains changes to the folder hierarchy.
[In Changes] It [Changes element] is used to update the client with folder additions, deletions, and updates on the server.
[In Changes] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.25] are defined in the FolderHierarchy namespace.
[In Changes] Element Changes in FolderSync command response (section 2.2.2.4), the parent element is FolderSync (section 2.2.3.71).

[In Changes] Element Changes in FolderSync command response (section 2.2.2.4), the child elements are Count (section 2.2.3.37), Update (section 2.2.3.177), Delete (section 2.2.3.42.1), Add (section 2.2.3.7.1).
[In Changes] Element Changes in FolderSync command response (section 2.2.2.4), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Changes] Element Changes in FolderSync command response (section 2.2.2.4), the number allowed is 0…1 (optional).

[In Changes] The server SHOULD maintain the same set of folder data being returned across synchronization key 0 (zero), in terms of ServerId (section 2.2.3.156.3) and DisplayName (section 2.2.3.47.3) mapping.

[In Changes] While the server SHOULD maintain this mapping [ServerId (section 2.2.3.156.3) and DisplayName (section 2.2.3.47.3) mapping], clients MUST be able to handle having the server return a completely different set of mapped data.
[In Changes] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Changes] element.
[In Changes] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Changes] element.
[In Changes] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Changes] element.
[In Changes] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Changes] element.
[In Changes] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Changes] element.

[In CheckCRL] The CheckCRL element is an optional child element of the ValidateCert element in ValidateCert command requests that specifies whether the server ignores an unverifiable revocation status.
[In CheckCRL] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.26] are defined in the ValidateCert namespace.
[In CheckCRL] Element CheckCRL in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the parent element is ValidateCert (section 2.2.3.185).
[In CheckCRL] None [Element CheckCRL in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21) has no child element.]
[In CheckCRL] Element CheckCRL in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the data type is integer ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.6).
[In CheckCRL] Element CheckCRL in ValidateCert command request (section 2.2.2.21), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In CheckCRL] The revocation status of a certificate cannot be verified when the certificate revocation lists (CRLs) cannot be retrieved.
[In CheckCRL] When the CheckCRL element value is set to 1 (TRUE), the server MUST NOT ignore an unverifiable revocation status.
[In CheckCRL] When the CheckCRL element value is set to 0 (FALSE), the server SHOULD ignore an unverifiable revocation status.
[In CheckCRL] The[CheckCRL] default value is 0 (zero).
[In CheckCRL] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [CheckCRL] element.
[In CheckCRL] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [CheckCRL] element.
[In CheckCRL] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [CheckCRL] element.
[In CheckCRL] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [CheckCRL] element.
[In CheckCRL] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [CheckCRL] element.

[In Class] The Class element is used in the following command requests and responses: Find command requests and responses (section 2.2.1.2) ,GetItemEstimate command requests (section 2.2.1.9) , ItemOperations command responses (section 2.2.1.10) , Ping command requests (section 2.2.1.13) , Search command requests (section 2.2.1.16) and responses , Sync command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.21)
[In Class] The definition of the Class element differs according to the context in which it [Class element] is used.
[In Class] For more details, see section 2.2.3.27.1, section 2.2.3.27.2, section 2.2.3.27.3, section 2.2.3.27.4, section 2.2.3.27.5 and section 2.2.3.27.6.
[In Class (Find)] The airsync:Class element is a required child element of the Query element in Find command requests.
[In Class (Find)] The airsync:Class element is a required child element of a required child element of the Result element in Find command responses.
[In Class (Find)] In both contexts, it[airsync:Class element] specifies the class of items retrieved by the search.
[In Class (Find)] Elements referenced in this section are defined in the Find namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.4).
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command request (section 2.2.1.2), the parent element is Query (section 2.2.3.142.1).
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command request (section 2.2.1.2) has no child element.]
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command request (section 2.2.1.2), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command request (section 2.2.1.2), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command response, the parent element is Result (section 2.2.3.155.1).
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command response, has no child element.]
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command response, the data type is string.
[In Class (Find)] Element Class(Find) in Find command response, the number allowed is 1...1 (required).
[In Class (Find)] In Find command requests, the only supported value for the airsync:Class element is "Email".
[In Class (Find)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [Class (Find)] element.
[In Class (Find)] Protocol version 14.0 does not support this [Class (Find)] element.
[In Class (Find)] Protocol version 14.1 does not support this [Class (Find)] element.
[In Class (Find)] Protocol version 16.0 does not support this [Class (Find)] element.
[In Class (Find)] Protocol version 16.1 does support this [Class (Find)] element.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:Class element is an optional child element of the airsync:Options element in GetItemEstimate command requests.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The getitemestimate:Class element is an optional child element of the Collection element in GetItemEstimate command requests.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The namespace and parent element of the Class element depend on the protocol version being used.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] See the details about protocol versions at the end of this section [2.2.3.27.1].
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] As a child of the Collection element, the getitemestimate:Class element specifies the type of a collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] As a child of the airsync:Options element, the airsync:Class element assigns the filters within the airsync:Options container to a given class.

[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Elements referenced in this section are defined in the GetItemEstimate namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Element Class(GetItemEstimate) in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the parent element is airsync:Options (section 2.2.3.119.1).
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] None [ Element Class(GetItemEstimate) in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8) has no child element.]
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Element Class(GetItemEstimate) in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Element Class(GetItemEstimate) in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Options for the same class within the same collection MUST NOT be redefined.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:Class element is not necessary for the default items contained within the collection (contacts in a Contacts folder for example).
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] For example, to sync SMS messages, include an airsync:Options node with class "SMS".
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] To also sync email messages at the same time, include another airsync:Options node with class "Email".
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Only SMS messages and email messages can be synchronized at the same time.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] A request for any other combination of classes will fail with a status value of 4.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The valid airsync:Class element values are: Tasks, Email, Calendar, Contacts, SMS, Notes.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] The valid getitemestimate:Class element values are: Tasks, Email, Calendar, Contacts.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of airsync:Options.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.0 does not support this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of airsync:Options.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.1 does not support this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of airsync:Options.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.0 does not support this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of airsync:Options.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.1 does not support this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Class(GetItemEstimate)] element [as] child of airsync:Options.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] The airsync:Class element is an optional child element of the Fetch element in ItemOperations command responses that indicates the class of the content of the fetched item.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] This [Class] element is defined in the AirSync namespace.

[In Class(ItemOperations)] Elements referenced in this section are defined in the ItemOperations namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Element Class(ItemOperations) in ItemOperations command response (section 2.2.2.9) fetch operation, the parent element is Fetch (section 2.2.3.63.1).
[In Class(ItemOperations)] None [Element Class(ItemOperations) in ItemOperations command response (section 2.2.2.9) fetch operation has no child element.]
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Element Class(ItemOperations) in ItemOperations command response (section 2.2.2.9) fetch operation, the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Element Class(ItemOperations) in ItemOperations command response (section 2.2.2.9) fetch operation, the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Class(ItemOperations)] The valid airsync:Class element values are as follows [Email, Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, SMS, Notes] for the latest protocol version.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Details about the protocol versions are provided at the end of this section [2.2.3.27.2].
[In Class(ItemOperations)] [The valid airsync:Class element values are asfollows for the latest protocol version:] Email, Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, SMS, Notes.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Class(ItemOperations)] element.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Class(ItemOperations)] element.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Class(ItemOperations)] element.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Class(ItemOperations)] element.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Class(ItemOperations)] element.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] The "SMS" and "Notes" values are valid only when the protocol version being used is 14.0, 14.1, or 16.0.
[In Class(ItemOperations)] The values "Tasks", "Email", "Calendar", and "Contacts" are valid for protocol versions 12.0, 12.1, 14.0, 14.1, 16.0 and 16.1.
[In Class(Ping)] The Class element is a required child element of the Folder element in Ping command requests that specifies the content class of the folder to be monitored.
[In Class(Ping)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.27.3] are defined in the Ping namespace.
[In Class(Ping)] Element Class(Ping) in Ping command request (section 2.2.2.12), the parent element is Folder (section 2.2.3.66).
[In Class(Ping)] None [ Element Class(Ping) in Ping command request (section 2.2.2.12) has no child element.]
[In Class(Ping)] Element Class(Ping) in Ping command request (section 2.2.2.12), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class(Ping)] Element Class(Ping) in Ping command request (section 2.2.2.12), the number allowed is 1…1 (required).
[In Class(Ping)] The valid Class element values are as follows for the latest protocol version.
[In Class(Ping)] Details about the protocol versions are provided at the end of this section [2.2.3.27.3].
[In Class(Ping)] [The valid Class element values are as follows for the latest protocol version:] Email, Calendar, Contacts, Tasks, Notes
[In Class(Ping)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Class(Ping)] element.
[In Class(Ping)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Class(Ping)] element.
[In Class(Ping)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Class(Ping)] element.
[In Class(Ping)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Class(Ping)] element.
[In Class(Ping)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Class(Ping)] element.
[In Class(Ping)] When the protocol version being used is 2.5, 12.0, or 12.1, the value "Notes" is not valid.
[In Class(Ping)] The values "Email", "Calendar, "Contacts", and "Tasks" are valid for all protocol versions.

[In Class(Search)] The airsync:Class element is an optional child element of the And element and the Schema element in Search command requests and a required child element of the Result element in Search command responses.
[In Class(Search)] The airsync:Class element is a required child element of the Result element in Search command responses.
[In Class(Search)] In all contexts, it [Class element] specifies the classes that the client wants returned for a given collection.

[In Class(Search)] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.27.4] are defined in the Search namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command request (section 2.2.2.15), the parent elements are And (section 2.2.3.10), Schema.
[In Class(Search)] None [Element Class(Search) in Search command request (section 2.2.2.15) has no child element.]
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command request (section 2.2.2.15), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command request (section 2.2.2.15), the number allowed is 0...N (optional).
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command response, the parent element is Result (section 2.2.3.146.2).
[In Class(Search)] None [Element Class(Search) in Search command response has no child element.]
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command response, the data type is string.
[In Class(Search)] Element Class(Search) in Search command response, the number allowed is 0…1 (optional).
[In Class(Search)] The valid airsync:Class element values are: Tasks, Email, Calendar, Contacts, Notes, SMS.
[In Class(Search)] The Search request can include one or more airsync:Class elements in the request to limit the type of data included in the Search response.
[In Class(Search)] If one or more airsync:Class elements are not included in the Search request, the server will return all supported classes.

[In Class(Search)] If the airsync:Class element is included as a child of any element other than the And element, the server responds with a Status element (section 2.2.3.162.12) value of 8 (SearchTooComplex).
[In Class(Search)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Class(Search)] element.
[In Class(Search)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Class(Search)] element.
[In Class(Search)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Class(Search)] element.
[In Class(Search)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Class(Search)] element.
[In Class(Search)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Class(Search)] element.
[In Class(Search)] The "SMS" and "Notes" values are valid only when the protocol version being used is 14.0, 14.1, 16.0 or 16.1.
[In Class(Search)] The values "Tasks", "Email", "Calendar", and "Contacts" are valid for protocol versions 12.0, 12.1, 14.0, 14.1, 16.0 and 16.1.
[In Class(Sync)] The Class element is an optional child element of the Add element or the Options element in Sync command requests.
[In Class(Sync)] The Class element is an optional child element of the Delete element, the Change element, or the Add element in Sync command responses.
[In Class(Sync)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.27.5] are defined in the AirSync namespace.
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent elements are Collection (section 2.2.3.29.2), Add (section 2.2.3.7.2), Options (section 2.2.3.119.5).
[In Class(Sync)] None [Element Class (Sync) in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20) has no child element.]
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).

[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command response, the parent elements are Collection (section 2.2.3.29.2), Delete (section 2.2.3.42.2), Change (section 2.2.3.24), Add (section 2.2.3.7.2).
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command response, the parent elements is Add (section 2.2.3.7.2).
[In Class(Sync)] None [Element Class (Sync) in Sync command response has no child element.]
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command response, the data type is string.
[In Class(Sync)] Element Class (Sync) in Sync command response, the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Class(Sync)] As a child element of the Add element in the Sync command request, the Class element identifies the class of the item being added to the collection.
[In Class(Sync)] As a child element of the Options element in the Sync command request, the Class element assigns the filters within the Options container to a given class.
[In Class(Sync)] Options for the same Class within the same Collection (section 2.2.3.29.2) MUST NOT be redefined.
[In Class(Sync)] A Status element (section 2.2.3.167.16) value of 4 is returned if options for the same Class within the same Collection are redefined.
[In Class(Sync)] The Class element is not necessary for the default items contained within the collection (contacts in a contacts folder for example).
[In Class(Sync)] For example, to sync SMS messages, include an Options node with class "SMS".
[In Class(Sync)] To also sync email messages at the same time, include another Options node with class "Email".
[In Class(Sync)] Only SMS messages and email messages can be synchronized at the same time.
[In Class(Sync)] A request for any other combination of classes will fail with a status value of 4.
[In Class(Sync)] The result of including more than one Class element as child elements of the Options element is undefined.
[In Class(Sync)] The server MAY return a protocol status error in response to such a command request [more than one Class element as child elements of the Options element].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-ASCMD_R938.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Class(Sync)] As a child element of the Delete element in the Sync command response, the Class element identifies the class of the item being deleted from the collection.
[In Class(Sync)] As a child element of the Change element in the Sync command response, the Class element identifies the class of the item being changed in the collection.
[In Class(Sync)] As a child element of the Add element in the Sync command response, the Class element identifies the class of the item being added to the collection.
[In Class(Sync)] The Class element is not included in Sync Add responses when the class of the collection matches the item class.
[In Class(Sync)] For example, a Sync command response for an email added to the Inbox folder would not include a Class element value of "Email" as the Inbox contains email class content by default.
[In Class(Sync)] However, a Sync command response for an SMS message added to the Inbox does include the Class value as SMS items are not the default class type of the Inbox.

[In Class(Sync)] In all contexts of a Sync command request or Sync command response, the valid Class element values are as follows [Tasks, Email, Calendar, Contacts, SMS, Notes] for the latest protocol version.
[In Class(Sync)] In all contexts of a Sync command request or Sync command response, the valid Class element value is Calendar.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Add, Options, Delete, Change.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 14.0 does not support this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Add, Options, Delete, Change.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 14.1 does not support this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Add, Options, Delete, Change.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 does not support this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Add, Options, Delete, Change.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 does not support this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Collection.
[In Class(Sync)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Class(Sync)] element [as] child of Add, Options, Delete, Change.
[In Class(Sync)] The "SMS" and "Notes" values are valid only when the protocol version being used is 14.0, 14.1, 16.0 or 16.1.
[In Class(Sync)] The values "Tasks", "Email", "Calendar", and "Contacts" are valid for all protocol versions.
[In Class(Sync)] The Class element is not present in the Sync response for an SMS deletion when protocol version 14.0 is used.

[In ClientId] The ClientId element is used in the following command requests and responses: SendMail command requests (section 2.2.2.15), SmartForward command requests (section 2.2.2.17), SmartReply command requests (section 2.2.2.18), Sync command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.19).
[In ClientId] The definition of the ClientId element differs according to the context in which it [ClientId element] is used.
[In ClientId] For more details, see section 2.2.3.28.1 and section 2.2.3.28.2.

[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] The ClientId element is a required child element of the SendMail element in SendMail command requests, a required child element of the SmartForward element in SmartForward command requests, and a required child element of the SmartReply element in SmartReply command requests.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] In all contexts, it [ClientId element] specifies the client's unique message ID (MID).
[In ClientId] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.28.1] are defined in the ComposeMail namespace.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SendMail command request (section 2.2.2.16), the parent element is SendMail (section 2.2.3.152).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] None [Element ClientId in SendMail command request (section 2.2.2.16) has no child element.]
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SendMail command request (section 2.2.2.16), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SendMail command request (section 2.2.2.16), the number allowed is 1...1 (required).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartForward command request (section 2.2.2.18), the parent element is SmartForward (section 2.2.3.159).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] None [Element ClientId in SmartForward command request (section 2.2.2.18) has no child element.]
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartForward command request (section 2.2.2.18), the data type is string.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartForward command request (section 2.2.2.18), the number allowed is 1...1 (required).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartReply command request (section 2.2.2.19), the parent element is SmartReply (section 2.2.3.160).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] None [ Element ClientId in SmartReply command request (section 2.2.2.19) has no child element.]
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartReply command request (section 2.2.2.19), the data type is string.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Element ClientId in SmartReply command request (section 2.2.2.19), the number allowed is 1...1 (required).
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] The ClientId element value can be up to 40 characters in length.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] [The ClientId element] MUST be unique for each message, as the server will use the ClientId element value to identify duplicate messages.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] The ClientId element value can be a simple counter incremented for each new message.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] element.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] element.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] element.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] element.
[In ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [ClientId(SendMail, SmartForward, and SmartReply)] element.

[In ClientId (Sync)] The ClientId element is a required child element of the Add element in Sync command requests and responses that contains a unique identifier (typically an integer) that is generated by the client to temporarily identify a new object that is being created by using the Add element.
[In ClientId (Sync)] The client includes the ClientId element in the Add element request that it sends to the server.

[In ClientId (Sync)] The server response contains an Add element that contains the original client ID and a new server ID that was assigned for the object, which replaces the client ID as the permanent object identifier.
[In ClientId (Sync)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.28.2] are defined in the AirSync namespace.
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Add (section 2.2.3.7.2).
[In ClientId (Sync)] None [Element ClientId in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20) has no child element.]
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is string ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7).
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 1…1 (required).
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command response, the parent element is Add (section 2.2.3.7.2).
[In ClientId (Sync)] None [Element ClientId in Sync command response has no child element.]
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command response, the data type is string.
[In ClientId (Sync)] Element ClientId in Sync command response, the number allowed is 1…1 (required).
[In ClientId (Sync)] The ClientId element is a unique identifier that consists of up to 64 digits and letters.
[In ClientId (Sync)] The client generates this ID {ClientId].
[In ClientId(Sync)] The [ClientId element ] value only has to be unique for the device during the duration of the Sync request that adds the object to the server.
[In ClientId(Sync)] The client stores the client IDs until the synchronization session is completed successfully, to make recovery easier if the synchronization process fails.
[In ClientId(Sync)] An easy way to implement the client ID is to use a counter that is incremented for each new object that is created on the client.
[In ClientId(Sync)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [ClientId(Sync)] element.
[In ClientId(Sync)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [ClientId(Sync)] element.
[In ClientId(Sync)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [ClientId(Sync)] element.
[In ClientId(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [ClientId(Sync)] element.
[In ClientId(Sync)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [ClientId(Sync)] element.

[In Collection] The Collection element is used in the following command requests and responses: GetItemEstimate command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.7), Sync command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.19).
[In Collection] The definition of the Collection element differs according to the context in which it is used. For more details, see section 2.2.3.29.1 and section 2.2.3.29.2.
[In Collection] For more details, see section 2.2.3.29.1 and section 2.2.3.29.2.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] The Collection element is a required child element of the Collections element in GetItemEstimate command requests.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] The Collection element is an optional child element of the Response element in GetItemEstimate command responses.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] In both contexts, it [Collection element] contains elements that apply to a particular collection.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] A maximum of 300 Collection elements can be included in a single Collections element.

[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.29.1] are defined in the GetItemEstimate namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the parent element is Collections (section 2.2.3.31.1).

[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the child elements are Class (section 2.2.27.1), airsync:SyncKey (section 2.2.3.171.3), CollectionId (section2.2.3.30.1), airsync:FilterType (section 2.2.3.64.1), airsync:ConversationMode (section2.2.3.36.1), airsync:Options (section 2.2.3.119.1).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command request (section 2.2.2.8), the number allowed is 1...300 (required).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command response, the parent element is Response (section 2.2.3.144.2).

[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command response, the child elements are Class (section 2.2.27.1), CollectionId (section 2.2.3.30.1), Estimate (section 2.2.3.62).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command response, the data type is container.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Element Collection in GetItemEstimate command response, the number allowed is 0…1 (optional).
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Collection(GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Collection(GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Collection(GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Collection(GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Collection(GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] The Class element is supported child elements of the Collection element only when protocol version 2.5, 12.0, or 12.1 is used.
[In Collection(GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:FilterType element is supported child elements of the Collection element only when protocol version 2.5, 12.0, or 12.1 is used.
[In Collection(Sync)] The Collection element is a required child element of the Collections element in Sync command requests.
[In Collection(Sync)] The Collection element is an optional child element in Sync command responses.
[In Collection(Sync)] In both contexts, it [Collection element] contains commands and options that apply to a particular collection.
[In Collection(Sync)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.29.2] are defined in the AirSync namespace.
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Collections (section 2.2.3.31.2).

[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the child elements are Class (section 2.2.3.27.5), SyncKey (section 2.2.3.171.4), Supported (section 2.2.3.169), CollectionId (section 2.2.3.30.5), DeletesAsMoves (section 2.2.3.43) , GetChanges (section 2.2.3.80), WindowSize (section 2.2.3.189), Options (section 2.2.3.119.5) , ConversationMode (section 2.2.3.36.2), Commands (section 2.2.3.32).
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2).
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 1...N (required).
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command response, the parent element is Collections.

[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command response, the child elements are Class, SyncKey, CollectionId, Status (section 2.2.3.167.16), MoreAvailable (section 2.2.3.110), Commands, Responses (section 2.2.3.145).
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command response, the data type is container.
[In Collection(Sync)] Element Collection in Sync command response, the number allowed is 0…N (optional).

[In Collection(Sync)] The Collection element contains identification information (CollectionId), synchronization state (SyncKey), commands (GetChanges, Commands), and options (WindowSize, Options, DeletesAsMoves, MoreAvailable).
[In Collection(Sync)] There is a strict ordering of the XML elements within a Collection node in a Sync command request.

[In Collection(Sync)] The order [of the XML elements within a Collection node in a Sync command request] is as follows: 1.SyncKey 2.CollectionId 3.Supported 4.DeletesAsMoves 5.GetChanges 6.WindowSize 7.ConversationMode 8.Options 9.Commands
[In Collection(Sync)] A single Collections element can contain multiple Collection elements.
[In Collection(Sync)] Therefore, each Collection does not require its own Sync command.
[In Collection(Sync)] That is, a Sync command request can specify multiple collections to be synchronized.
[In Collection(Sync)] Protocol version 12.1 supports this [Collection(Sync)] element.
[In Collection(Sync)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [Collection(Sync)] element.
[In Collection(Sync)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Collection(Sync)] element.
[In Collection(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Collection(Sync)] element.
[In Collection(Sync)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Collection(Sync)] element.
[In Collection(Sync)] The Class element is a supported child element of the Collection element only when protocol version 2.5, 12.0, or 12.1 is used.

[In CollectionId] The CollectionId element is used in the following command requests and responses:Find command requests and responses (section 2.2.1.2), GetItemEstimate command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.7), ItemOperations command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.8), MeetingResponse command requests (section 2.2.2.9), Search command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.14), Sync command requests and responses (section 2.2.2.19).

[In CollectionId (Find)] The airsync:CollectionId element is an optional child element of the Query element in Find command requests that specifies the folder in which to search.
[In CollectionId (Find)] The airsync:CollectionId element is a required child element of the Result element in Find command responses that specifies the folder in which the item was found.

[In CollectionId (Find)] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.30.1] are defined in the Find namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.4).

[In CollectionId (Find)] None [Element in Find command request (section 2.2.1.2) has no child element.]

[In CollectionId (Find)] If no airsync:CollectionId element is present, the Find command request will apply to all folders returned in the FolderSync command response (section 2.2.1.5) and conduct a global search.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] The CollectionId element value is not larger than 64 characters in length.

[In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] The CollectionId element value sent in the GetItemEstimate command request corresponds to the Server ID value assigned to the folder containing the item to retrieve.

[In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] The collection ID is obtained from the folderhierarchy:ServerId element (section 2.2.3.156) of a previous FolderSync command response (section 2.2.2.4) or FolderCreate command response (section 2.2.2.2).
[In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] The client SHOULD store folderhierarchy:ServerId values as they are returned by the server in FolderSync and FolderCreate command responses.

[In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] element.

[In CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [CollectionId(GetItemEstimate)] element.

[In CollectionId(Sync)] The CollectionId value "RI" specifies the recipient information cache, which contains a list of contacts that the user has interacted with most often in the near term, and with whom the user is likely to interact again.
[In CollectionId(Sync)] The recipient information cache is a special folder (similar to the Inbox folder), which limits the operations that can be performed on it.

[In Commands] The Commands element is an optional child element of the Collection element in Sync command requests and responses that contains operations that apply to a collection.
[In Commands] Available operations are add, delete, change, fetch, and soft delete.
[In Commands] Client operations are sent in the POST request.
[In Commands] Server commands are sent in the POST response.
[In Commands] This [Commands] element is optional.
[In Commands] If it [Commands] is present, it MUST include at least one operation.
[In Commands] It [Commands] is a child of the Collection element.
[In Commands] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.32] are defined in the AirSync namespace.
[In Commands] Element Commands in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Collection (section 2.2.3.29.2).

[In Conflict] The Conflict element is an optional child element of the Options element in Sync command requests that specifies how to resolve the conflict that occurs when an object has been changed on both the client and the server.
[In Conflict] The value specifies which object—the client object or the server object—to keep if there is a conflict.
[In Conflict] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.34] are defined in the AirSync namespace.
[In Conflict] Element Conflict in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Options (section 2.2.3.119.5).
[In Conflict] None [Element Conflict in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20) has no child element.]
[In Conflict] Element Conflict in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is unsignedByte ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.8).
[In Conflict] Element Conflict in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In Conflict] The following table lists valid values [0,1] for the element [Conflict].
[In Conflict] The value 0 means client object replaces server object.
[In Conflict] The value 1 means server object replaces client object.
[In Conflict] If the Conflict element is not present, the server object will replace the client object when a conflict occurs.
[In Conflict] A value of 0 (zero) means to keep the client object.
[In Conflict] A value of 1 means to keep the server object.

[In Conflict] If the value is 1 and there is a conflict, a Status element (section 2.2.3.167.16) value of 7 is returned to inform the client that the object that the client sent to the server was discarded.
[In Conflict] The Conflict element applies to the entire collection.
[In Conflict] Therefore, it is not possible to apply the Conflict element value to individual items within the collection.
[In Conflict] The Conflict element is a child of the Options element, and therefore the Conflict element appears only in requests to the server from the client.
[In Conflict] The result of including more than one Conflict element as the child of an Options element is undefined.
[In Conflict] The server MAY return a protocol status error in response to such a command request [more than one Conflict element as the child of an Options element].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-ASCMD_R2075.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Conflict] If a Delete element (section 2.2.3.42.2) conflicts with an Add (section 2.2.3.7.2) or Change element (section 2.2.3.24), the Delete element takes precedence.

[In Conflict] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Conflict] element.
[In Conflict] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [Conflict] element.

[In ConversationId(ItemOperations)] Element ConversationId in ItemOperations command response Move operation, the data type is string.

[In ConversationId(Search)] The [ConversationId element] value is a GUID.
[In ConversationId(Search)] For details, see [MS-ASCON].
[In ConversationId(Search)] All elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.35.2] are defined in the Search namespace.

[In ConversationId] Element ConversationId in Search command request (section 2.2.2.15), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).

[In ConversationId(Search)] If the ConversationId element is included as a child of any element other than the And element, the server responds with a Status element (section 2.2.3.167.12) value of 8 (SearchTooComplex).
[In ConversationId(Search)] The result of including more than one ConversationId element in a Search command request is undefined.
[In ConversationId(Search)] The server SHOULD return a protocol status error in response to such a command request [more than one ConversationId element in a Search command request].

[In ConversationMode] The ConversationMode element is used in the following command requests: GetItemEstimate command requests (section 2.2.2.7), Sync command requests (section 2.2.2.19)
[In ConversationMode] The definition of the ConversationId element differs according to the context in which it [ConversationId element] is used.
[In ConversationMode] For more details, see section 2.2.3.36.1 and section 2.2.3.36.2.

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:ConversationMode element is an optional child element of the Collection element in GetItemEstimate command requests that specifies whether to include items that are included within the conversation modality within the results of the GetItemEstimate command response (section 2.2.2.8).

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] A single conversation MAY span multiple collections and therefore airsync:ConversationMode is a child of the Collection element, rather than the airsync:Options element (section 2.2.3.119.1).

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.36.1] are defined in the GetItemEstimate namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Element ConversationMode in GetItemEstimate command request, the parent element is Collection (section 2.2.3.29.1).
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] None [Element ConversationMode in GetItemEstimate command request has no child element.]
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Element ConversationMode in GetItemEstimate command request, the data type is boolean ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.1).
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Element ConversationMode in GetItemEstimate command request, the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Setting the airsync:ConversationMode element to 0 (FALSE) in a GetItemEstimate request results in an Estimate element (section 2.2.3.62) value that only includes items that meet the airsync:FilterType element (section 2.2.3.64.1) value.

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Setting the airsync:ConversationMode element to 1 (TRUE) expands the result set to also include items with identical email2:ConversationId element (as specified in [MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.21) values to those in the airsync:FilterType result set.

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:ConversationMode element value has no impact on items outside the collection specified by the CollectionId element (section 2.2.3.30.1), the result set is always limited to items in the specified collection.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] The airsync:ConversationMode element value only limits or expands the results determined by the airsync:FilterType element value.

[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Specifying the airsync:ConversationMode element for collections that do not store email results in an invalid XML error, Status element (section 2.2.3.167.6) value 103.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] element.
[In ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [ConversationMode (GetItemEstimate)] element.

[In ConversationMode(Sync)] The ConversationMode element is an optional child element of the Collection element in Sync command requests that specifies whether to include items that are included within the conversation modality within the results of the Sync response.

[In ConversationMode(Sync)] A single conversation MAY span multiple classes, and therefore ConversationMode is a child of the Collection element as opposed to the Options element (section 2.2.3.119.5).

[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Elements referenced in this section [2.2.3.36.2] are defined in the AirSync namespace, except where otherwise indicated by the presence of a namespace prefix (as defined in section 2.2.1).
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Element ConversationMode in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the parent element is Collection (section 2.2.3.29.2).
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] None [Element ConversationMode in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20) has no child element.]
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Element ConversationMode in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the data type is boolean ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.1).
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Element ConversationMode in Sync command request (section 2.2.2.20), the number allowed is 0...1 (optional).
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Setting the ConversationMode element value to 1 (TRUE) results in retrieving all emails that match the conversations received within the date filter specified.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] However, although the body of the emails outside of that time based filter will not be retrieved, the text previews will be retrieved if the previews were requested.

[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Setting the ConversationMode element value to 0 (FALSE) in a Sync request results in the synchronization of items that meet the criteria of the FilterType element (section 2.2.3.64) value.

[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Setting the ConversationMode element value to 1 (TRUE) expands the result set to also include any items with identical email2:ConversationId ([MS-ASEMAIL] section 2.2.2.21) values to those in the FilterType result set.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] The ConversationMode element value has no impact on items outside the collection specified by the CollectionId element (section 2.2.3.30.5);
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] The result set is always limited to items in the specified collection.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] The ConversationMode element value only limits or expands the results determined by the FilterType element value.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Specifying the ConversationMode element for collections that do not store emails results in an invalid XML error, Status element (section 2.2.3.167.16) value 4.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Protocol version 12.1 does not support this [ConversationMode(Sync)] element.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Protocol version 14.0 supports this [ConversationMode(Sync)] element.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [ConversationMode(Sync)] element.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [ConversationMode(Sync)] element.
[In ConversationMode(Sync)] Protocol version 16.1 supports this [ConversationMode(Sync)] element.

[In Count] Protocol version 14.1 supports this [Count] element.
[In Count] Protocol version 16.0 supports this [Count] element.
